ð—”ð—ºð—¯ð—®ð˜€ð˜€ð—®ð—±ð—¼ð—¿ð˜€: Matt Murphy and Jen Smela
Contacts: jsmela@psdschools.org
Room: W-210
Schedule: Daily, Period 1
Description: Ambassadors is a servant-leadership class that does peer education at Fossil and our feeder middle schools on sexual assault/harassment prevention, teen dating violence prevention, and mental wellness. We serve as mentors to elementary students at Timnath Elementary and Bacon Elementary as well as offer tours for new and prospective students at Fossil. Ambassadors seek to provide support for our fellow Sabercats!

ð—”ð—ºð—»ð—²ð˜€ð˜ð˜† ð—œð—»ð˜ð—²ð—¿ð—»ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð—®ð—¹: J. Speight
Contacts: jspeight@psdschools.org
Room: W-105
Schedule: Tuesday, 12:15 â€“ 12:45
Description: We work to protect people wherever justice, freedom, truth, and dignity are denied. Amnesty International is a global movement of millions of people demanding human rights for all people â€“ no matter who they are or where they are. Our AI club has gotten together with other PSD Amnesty clubs over the years and has done a variety of group projects and individual work to raise awareness for Human Rights.

ð—”ð—¿ð˜ ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: C. Ermer
Contacts: chelseae@psdschools.org
Room: 245
Schedule: Monday, 4:10 â€“ 5:10 pm
Description: Art Club is a place to come be social and integrate some art therapy into your life. Every week we create a new fun art project that you can take home at the end. Come hang out and get some art in your life.

ð—”ð˜€ð—¶ð—®ð—» ð—¦ð˜ð˜‚ð—±ð—²ð—»ð˜ ð—¢ð—¿ð—´ð—®ð—»ð—¶ð˜‡ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»: N. Henry
Contacts: nhenry@psdschools.org
Room: W-208
Schedule: Friday, Lunch
 Description: The purpose of Asian Student Organization is to spread awareness and educate about the common struggles Asian Americans have. It is also to create a space where a group can interact and spread and share culture.

ð—•ð—¹ð—®ð—°ð—¸ ð—¦ð˜ð˜‚ð—±ð—²ð—»ð˜ ð—¨ð—»ð—¶ð—¼ð—»: E. Breese
 Contacts: ebreese@psdschools.org
Room: E-209
Schedule: Monday, 12:15 â€“ 12:50
Description: The goal of this club is to provide students with an opportunity to engage in activities and discussions designed to help foster a better understanding of experiences and issues that impact Black students. This club is open to all students regardless of racial and/or cultural differences. This club welcomes diversity and provides space for rich discussion, understanding, and acceptance.

ð—–ð—®ð—³ð—²â€™ ð—¦ð—®ð—» ð—ð˜‚ð—®ð—»: M. Nortier
Contacts: mnortier@psdschools.org
Room: W-210
Schedule: Friday, 12:14 â€“ 12:57
Description: Come join us during lunch to learn about different foods, play games and socialize. No need to speak Spanish. Everyone is welcome!!

ð—–ð—µð—²ð˜€ð˜€ ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: C. Fries and M. VasaContacts: cfries@psdschools.org
Room: TBD
Schedule: Tuesday, 12:14 â€“ 12:57
Description: Chess Club meets to learn new chess techniques, practice against each other, and eventually participate in games against other chess players.

ð—–ð—µð—¼ð—°ð—¼ð—¹ð—®ð˜ð—² ð—•ð—¼ð—¼ð—¸ ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: L. Fain
Contacts: lanaf@psdschools.org
Room: 402 (Mind Center)
Schedule: TBD, 12:20 â€“ 12:50
Description: Join Book Club! If you like to read and enjoy discussing books that interest you, come to the Chocolate Book Club lunchtime meetings. Whether your favorite genre is science fiction, fantasy, realistic fiction, or nonfiction, come join others with similar interests.

ð—–ð—¼ð—±ð—¶ð—»ð—´ ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: S. Ruffer
Contact: sruffer@psdschools.org
Room: 209
Schedule: Wednesday, 12:15 â€“ 1:00
Description: Coding club meets to discuss, practice and create anything in the realm of Computer Science. Students work on projects, design apps, and many participate in HPâ€™s CodeWars.

ð——ð—˜ð—–ð—”: A. Stevens
Contacts: astevens@psdschools.org
Schedule:Roundhouse Tuesday, 12:15 â€“ 12:30
Description: DECA is a co-curricular marketing program which offers students an opportunity for professional growth, community service and competition through examination, role play, portfolio planning and public speaking. There are opportunities to compete and to run for offices at the local, district, state and national levels. Rotating Thursdays with FBLA. Contact Andy Stevens for more information.

ð——ð—¿ð—®ð—ºð—® ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯/ð—§ð—²ð—°ð—µ ð—§ð—µð—²ð—®ð˜ð—¿ð—²: K. Rust and M. Assmus
Contacts: krust@psdschools.org
Room: Black Box (241)
Schedule: TBD
Description: Join the Drama Club to have fun onstage and off with new friends! This club is run by student leaders. Each year holds unique opportunities such as seeing other shows, attending the State Thespian Conference (ThesCon) in Denver, and the International Theatre Festival this summer. Drama Club is your resource to finding out more about these rewarding activities!

ð—˜ð—»ð—´ð—¶ð—»ð—²ð—²ð—¿ð—¶ð—»ð—´ ð—•ð—¿ð—¶ð—´ð—µð˜ð—»ð—²ð˜€ð˜€: H Beaven
Contacts: hbeaven@psdschools.org
Room: 213
Schedule: Tuesday / Thursday, 4:00 â€“ 5:30 pm
Description: Engineering Brightness is tackling the need for third-world countries to have solar lighting for their homes. The team is focused on designing and producing solar lanterns for this purpose. The team is very welcoming, and we have a good time together! Come join us for some hands-on designing and fabrication.

ð—˜ð˜ð—°ð—µð—²ð—± ð—¶ð—» ð—¦ð˜ð—¼ð—»ð—²: B. DeGear
Contacts: bdegear@psdschools.org
Room: N-123
Schedule: M â€“ F TBD
Description: Etched in Stone is the student run newspaper covering Fossil Ridge High School.

ð—™ð—•ð—Ÿð—”: J. Vandermeulen
Contacts: jordanv@psdschools.org
Room: Roundhouse
Schedule: Tuesday, 12:14 â€“ 12:45
Description: Future Business Leaders of America prepares emerging student leaders for roles in the workforce through their focus on service, education, and progress. FBLA meets regularly in preparation for competitive events primarily in the spring.

ð—™ð—–ð—–ð—Ÿð—”: K. Felske
Contacts: kfelske@psdschools.org
Room: 506
Schedule: Wednesday, 12:15 â€“ 12:45
Description: FCCLA (Family, Career, and Community Leaders of America) is a student organization that promotes personal growth and leadership through Family and Consumer Sciences content. Using creativity and critical thinking, FCCLA members focus on developing skills to strengthen their family units, enhance community involvement, and prepare for life after high school. FCCLA provides opportunities for active students at local, state, and national levels.

ð—™ð—¼ð˜€ð˜€ð—¶ð—¹ ð—™ð—¿ð—¶ð—²ð—»ð—±ð˜€: B. Winter
Contacts: bwinter@psdschools.org
Room: N-225
Schedule: Wednesday, TBD
Description: At Fossil Friends, we aim to provide friendship and support to people of all abilities. All are welcome!

ð—™ð—¼ð˜€ð˜€ð—¶ð—¹â€™ð˜€ ð—šð—¦ð—”: T. Forkner
Contacts: tforkner@psdschools.org
Room: E-104
Schedule: Tuesday, 12:14 â€“ 12:57
Description: Fossil's gender and sexuality alliance is a club for LGBTQ+ students and allies where they can seek support, information and communality. Our mission is to work towards a more inclusive environment for all people regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. We believe that schools can be truly safe only when every student is assured of access to an education without fear of harassment or violence.

ð—™ð—¿ð—²ð—»ð—°ð—µ ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: S. Sexton
Contacts: ssexton@psdschools.org
Room: W-208
Schedule:Thursday, 12:14 â€“ 12:45
Description: We will learn about the French language and culture through music, movies food and discussion. No prior French necessary - all are welcome!

ð—™ð—¥ð—˜ð—¦ð—›: L. Smyser
Contacts: lsmyser@psdschools.org
Room: N-104
Schedule: Wednesday, 12:15 â€“ 12:45
Description: FRESH Club is for any student who wants to learn more about environmental causes, issues and action steps. We are a group of students who care about each other, the community in which we live and our planet. We focus on local, actionable steps we can take to be more responsible users of resources.

ð—™ð—¥ð—›ð—¦ ð—–ð˜†ð—°ð—¹ð—¶ð—»ð—´ ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: J. Speight
Contacts: jspeight@psdschools.org
Room: W-105
Schedule: TBD
Description: Hey, everyone who enjoys road, mountain or cycle cross riding! Come join the FRHS cycling club to get better connected with fellow riders, trails in our area and race/safety updates.

ð—šð—®ð—ºð—²ð˜€ and ð—¦ð—¶ð—ºð˜‚ð—¹ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð˜€ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: N. Peardot
Contacts: npeardot@psdschools.org
Room: W-106
Schedule: Wednesday, 4:15 â€“ 6:15
Description: Join us for inclusive fun playing board/simulation/role-playing/video/card games of all kinds! If you would like to meet new people, make great friends, and play your favorite games in a stress-free environment then this is the place for you! Please join us on Wednesday evenings beginning 8/25 from 4:15-6:15 in room W106. See you there!

ð—šð—®ð—ºð—² ð—§ð—¶ð—ºð—² ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: J. Menefee
Contacts: jmenefee@psdschools.org
Room: Round House
Schedule: Friday, 12:10 â€“ 1:00
Description: The GameTime Club's number one goal is to increase support, interest and attendance for Fossil Ridge sports. We also discuss college and professional sports.

ð—šð—²ð—¿ð—ºð—®ð—» ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: A. Healy
Contacts: ahealy@psdschools.org
Room: W-203
Schedule: Tuesday, Lunch
Description: Hallo! If you want to experience international culture, join us! German Club will offer activities for students who want to experience more of the German culture. We will eat, sing, dance, play games, watch movies and celebrate holidays and festivals. Come help us plan Oktoberfest! We may be able to go to the International Film Night at CSU, the Lincoln Center and restaurants. Auf Wiedersehen!

ð—›ð—¶ð˜€ð˜ð—¼ð—¿ð˜† ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: E. Cooper
Contacts: emilyc@psdschools.org
Room: TBD
Schedule: TBD
Description: TBD

ð—œð—»ð˜ƒð—²ð˜€ð˜ð—ºð—²ð—»ð˜ ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: A. Stevens
Contacts: astevens@psdschools.org
Room: 203
Schedule: Thursday, Lunch
Description: Students will meet weekly and discuss the stock market and investment opportunities. Using education from the club, students can develop strategies with their friends and have a support network for investment and financial planning.

ð—žð—²ð˜† ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: E. Carson
Contacts: ecarson@psdschools.org
Room: Round House
Schedule: Wednesday, 4:00 â€“ 6:00
Description: Key Club is a student-led, high school organization. Our members make the world a better place through service. In doing so, we grow as individuals and as leaders by answering the call to lead, summoning the courage to engage and developing the heart to serve.

ð—žð—»ð—¼ð˜„ð—¹ð—²ð—±ð—´ð—² ð—•ð—¼ð˜„ð—¹: K. Rude
Contacts: krude@psdschools.org
Room: E-102
Schedule: Wednesday, 4:00 â€“ 6:00 pm
Description: Knowledge Bowl is a trivia game that includes questions from all academic high school disciplines. Students compete in teams of 4 buzzing in to answer questions and prove their knowledge.

Contacts: Bgallagh@psdschools.org
Room: 205
Schedule: Daily Q-4, Period 4
Description: TBD

Schedule: TBD
Description: TBD

ð— ð—¼ð—°ð—¸ ð—§ð—¿ð—¶ð—®ð—¹: M. Bassett
Contacts: mbassett@psdschools.org
Room: N-101
Schedule: Wednesday, 12:14 â€“ 12:50
Description: Groups of students participate in a mock trail and compete against other northern Colorado schools at a regional competition. Students take on the roles of attorneys or coaches. Students can be any grade level, however returning students will probably be given priority when assigning roles.

ð— ð—¨ð—¡ ð— ð—¼ð—±ð—²ð—¹ ð—¨ð—»ð—¶ð˜ð—²ð—± ð—¡ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð˜€: N. Oâ€™Dwyer
Contacts: nodwyer@psdschools.org
Room: N-223
Schedule: Thursday, 12:15 â€“ 12:50
Description: Model United Nations is a simulation of the United Nations where students play the role of delegates from different countries and attempt to solve real world issues with the policies and perspectives of their assigned country. At our weekly meetings we discuss topics from around the world and prepare for conferences, all in a fun and supportive environment. You are welcome to bring your lunch to our meetings on Thursdays.

ð— ð˜‚ ð—”ð—¹ð—½ð—µð—® ð—§ð—µð—²ð˜ð—® ð— ð—®ð˜ð—µ ð—›ð—¼ð—»ð—¼ð—¿ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: T. Pfeiffer
Contacts: tpfeifer@psdschools.org
Room: Roundhouse
Schedule: Monday, 12:20 â€“ 12:50
Description: If you like mathematics, are interested in using your math knowledge to help other students, and want to be recognized for your mathematical accomplishments, consider joining Fossil Ridge's Mu Alpha Theta Mathematics Honor Society chapter. Mu Alpha Theta has numerous exciting events, activities, and community service opportunities. We are dedicated to inspiring keen interest in mathematics, developing strong scholarship in mathematics, reaching out to the community through mathematics tutoring, and promoting the enjoyment of mathematics in high school.

ð— ð˜‚ð˜€ð—¶ð—° ð—£ð—¿ð—¼ð—±ð˜‚ð—°ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—» ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯ (ð— ð—£ð—–): N. Titus
Contacts: ntitus@psdschools.org
Room: 231
Schedule; Wednesday, 4:15 â€“ 5:15
Description: The Music Production Club (MPC) connects student music producers and students interested in music production! We foster a community in which students can collaborate to record and produce music, as well as learn from each other and receive feedback. Note: Music production is the process of using technology to record or synthesize music. Computers, microphones, synthesizers, and virtual instruments are commonly used tools. We meet every Wednesday from 4:15 - 5:15 starting 9/1/21 in the music production lab (room 231)

ð—¡ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð—®ð—¹ ð—”ð—¿ð˜ ð—›ð—¼ð—»ð—¼ð—¿ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: C. Ermer
Contacts: chelseae@psdschools.org
Room: TBD
Schedule: TBD
Description: TBD

ð—¡ð—•ð—›ð—¦ (ð—¡ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð—®ð—¹ ð—•ð˜‚ð˜€ð—¶ð—»ð—²ð˜€ð˜€ ð—›ð—¼ð—»ð—¼ð—¿ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†): K. Seeton
Contacts: kseeton@psdschools.org

Room: Roundhouse (by invitation only)

Schedule: Thursday, 12:15 â€“ 12:55
Description: National Business Honor Society honors students who have excelled in the business pathway. As a junior or senior, students will be invited to join NBHS. Students must take at least three classes in the business pathway (business, marketing, computers), earn a 3.5 business class GPA and 3.1 overall GPA. They must also belong to a business student organization (FBLA, DECA, Mock Trial) and show excellence of character.

ð—¡ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð—®ð—¹ ð—˜ð—»ð—´ð—¹ð—¶ð˜€ð—µ ð—›ð—¼ð—»ð—¼ð—¿ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: K. Rude
Contacts: krude@psdschools.org
Room: Roundhouse
Schedule: 1st Wednesday ea. Month, 12:14 â€“ 12:57
Description: NEHS is an honor society for students who love English Language Arts. Members must have taken 1 year of English courses at FRHS with a high average English GPA to be eligible for induction to NEHS. There is an application process to join the honor society. NEHS activities include tutoring/writing lab opportunities, participation in events with other honor societies, book drives, book club, etc.

ð—¡ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð—®ð—¹ ð—›ð—¼ð—»ð—¼ð—¿ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: S. Ruffer
Contacts: sruffer@psdschools.org
Room: PAC
Schedule: Thursday, 12:14 â€“ 12:57
Description: The National Honor Society is a nationwide organization for high school students in the United States. Selection is based on four criteria: scholarship, leadership, service, and character. NHS is a service organization in which members spend a minimum of 20 hours each school year serving our school, city, and community.

ð—¡ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð—®ð—¹ ð—§ð—²ð—°ð—µð—»ð—¶ð—°ð—®ð—¹ ð—›ð—¼ð—»ð—¼ð—¿ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: P. Didero
Contacts: pdidero@psdschools.org
Room: Roundhouse
Schedule: Thursday 12:20 â€“ 12:45
Description: NTHS honors the achievements of top Career and Technical Education students and cultivates excellence in todayâ€™s highly competitive, skilled workforce.https://sites.google.com/psdschools.org/frh-learning-business-didero/nths

ð—£ð—²ð˜ð—¿ð—¼ð—´ð—¹ð˜†ð—½ð—µð˜€ ð—™ð—¥ð—›ð—¦ ð—¬ð—²ð—®ð—¿ð—¯ð—¼ð—¼ð—¸: K. Salz
Contacts: ksalz@psdschools.org
Room: E-110
Schedule: Daily, Quarters 1 and 2, Period 2

ð—£ð—µð—¶ð—¹ð—¼ð˜€ð—¼ð—½ð—µð˜† ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: R. Marshall
Contacts: dmarshal@psdschools.org
Room: W-108
Schedule: Thursday, 4:05 â€“ 5:30
Description: An informal as well as academic look into the history and uses of philosophy. The purpose of this club is to create a better understanding of philosophy that will enhance critical thinking, explore knowledge and how it is attained, and challenge participants to deeply examine the ideas they value or are curious about. Reading selections are guided by club member choice , and everyone is invited to select key readings and topics, as well as facilitate discussions when they feel comfortable doing so.

ð—£ð—µð—¼ð˜ð—¼ð—´ð—¿ð—®ð—½ð—µð—²ð—¿ð˜€ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: R. Black
Contacts: rebeccak@psdschools.org
Room: TBD
Schedule: TBD
ð—¥ð—¶ð—±ð—´ð—² ð—Ÿð—²ð—®ð—±ð—²ð—¿ð˜€ð—µð—¶ð—½: T. Ivan
Contacts: tivan@psdschools.org
Room: Roundhouse
Schedule: Daily, Quarters 1 and 2 ,Period 4
Description: RIDGE Leadership is a course for students who seek out opportunities to expand, learn and practice all areas of leadership. Our focus is servant leadership through collaboration in order to plan events, promote diversity and inclusion, create a family atmosphere and increase awareness and acceptance of all populations. As a team, RIDGE Leaders improve and grow in the art of leadership and apply their knowledge to improve the climate, culture and spirit of FRHS. This is achieved by building strong relationships, engaging in inclusivity/equity training and planning exciting activities for school. (Selection for this class is lottery based.)

ð—¥ð—¶ð—±ð—´ð—²ð—¯ð—¼ð˜ð—¶ð—°ð˜€: H. Beaven
Contacts: hbeaven@psdschools.org
Room: 215
Schedule: Daily, 4:00 â€“ 6:00
Description: Ridgebotics is an amazing team of mentors and students that work together to build robots designed to compete against other local teams, regionally in Denver and, if the team advances, we compete at the national level as well. In January, the FIRST Robotics organization reveals the build/game challenge for the season, with the actual competitions occurring in March thru April. Come join a team that will expand your skillset, reinforce RIDGE values and will welcome you!

ð—¦ð—®ð—¯ð—²ð—¿ð—–ð—®ð˜ ð—™ð—¶ð—¹ð—ºð˜€: B. Gallagher
Contacts: bgallagh@psdschools.org
Room: 205
Schedule: Wednesday, 12:15 â€“ 12:45
Description: Students interested in movies and filmmaking gather to discuss films, techniques, and the impacts of different movies on our culture. We emphasize student voice and encourage members to present their own thoughts about a movie or scene and facilitate discussions. You may letter in this club.

ð—¦ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð—»ð—°ð—² ð—•ð—¼ð˜„ð—¹: B. Reidel
Contacts: briedel@psdschools.org
Room: N-109
Schedule: Friday, 12:14 â€“ 12:57
Description: Essentially like a Science Jeopardy, answering questions on various science topics. There are competitions between schools.

ð—¦ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð—»ð—°ð—² ð—¢ð—¹ð˜†ð—ºð—½ð—¶ð—®ð—±: M. Vigil
Contacts: mvigil@psdschools.org
Room: Science Wing or Roundhouse
Schedule: Daily, 4:00 â€“ 5:00
Description: This school sponsored club provides rigorous standards-based competitions to middle school and high school students in all fifty states. Students compete as teams of fifteen members in 23 different science events. These events cover a wide range of science topics through academic exams, lab practicals, and building events. By preparing for competitions, students gain an in-depth knowledge of areas in science and technology.

ð—¦ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð—»ð—°ð—² ð—¡ð—®ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—»ð—®ð—¹ ð—›ð—¼ð—»ð—¼ð—¿ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: J. Bekken
Contacts: jbekken@psdschools.org
Room: Roundhouse
Schedule: 3rd Monday per month, Lunch
Description: SNHS encourages and recognizes students in the sciences. The society encourages scientific and intellectual thought, helps to advance the knowledge of classical and modern sciences seeks to aid the community with their understanding of science, and encourages community service related to science. Meeting dates will be provided at a later date.

ð—¦ð—¸ð—¶ð—¹ð—¹ð˜€ ð—¨ð—¦ð—”: H. Beaven
Contacts: hbeaven@psdschools.org
Room: TBD
Schedule: TBD

ð—¦ð—½ð—²ð—²ð—°ð—µ ð—®ð—»ð—± ð——ð—²ð—¯ð—®ð˜ð—²: R. Jackson
Contacts: rjackson@psdschools.org
Room: N-209
Schedule: Tuesday, 12:15 â€“ 12:40
Description: Speech and debate allows students to step outside themselves and their comfort zone through the joy and enthusiasm that comes from public speaking. Students can find events where they can express themselves and inhabit the hopes and fears of fictional characters through dramatic or humorous interpretation. Students can also be exposed to current events through any number of debate events or speaking events!

ð—§ð—²ð—°ð—µð—»ð—¶ð—°ð—®ð—¹ ð—§ð—µð—²ð—®ð˜ð—¿ð—² ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: J. Garner
Contacts: jgarner@psdschools.org
Room: Scene Shop, PAC, Lighting Booth, etc.
Schedule: Daily, 4:00 â€“ 6:00
Description: Students meet after school everyday on a variable schedule starting after auditions for the Fall Play or Spring Musical. They work in as many as ten different crews designing costumes, stage scenery, lighting, sound, hair, makeup, props, marketing, stage management and projections for the school productions. This is the club corresponding to the Technical Theatre Certification class. Most students will choose to get school credit by meeting the number of required hours, but there are frequently positions that are filled by students who only want to be part of the club. Talk to Mr. Garner about the options for participation or with questions about the work crews do.

ð—§ð—¿ð—¶-ð— ð— ð˜‚ð˜€ð—¶ð—° ð—›ð—¼ð—»ð—¼ð—¿ ð—¦ð—¼ð—°ð—¶ð—²ð˜ð˜†: L. Silvestri
Contacts: lsilvest@psdschools.org
Room: 241 (Blackbox)
Schedule: Thursday, 12:15 â€“ 12:45
Description: The only national organization dedicated to excellence and community service in Music. This organization is open to students in grades 9-12 who are active in Fossil Ridge High School music.

ð—¨ð—¸ð—² ð—¥ð—²ð˜ƒð—¼ð—¹ð˜‚ð˜ð—¶ð—¼ð—» ð—¨ð—¸ð˜‚ð—¹ð—²ð—¹ð—² ð—–ð—¹ð˜‚ð—¯: L. Fain
Contacts: lanaf@psdschools.org
Room: Mind Center or Courtyard
Schedule: TBD
Description: Do you play the ukulele or want to learn how? Join Uke Revolution to have some strumming fun. Our media center checks out ukuleles, so stop on in and check one out. There are three sizes available, to suit every player.
